question: Pilgrims to which of the following Hindu lakes used to consider “eaten by crocodiles” as sacred until the British caught the crocodiles and shifted them to nearby reservoir?
explanation: Pushkar Lake is located in the state of Rajasthan. It is considered as a sacred lake of the Hindus. Pilgrims of Pushkar Lake used to believe that “eaten by crocodiles” is sacred until the British caught the crocodiles and shifted them to nearby reservoir.
